meanings.definition: To place or position in advance.
meanings.sent1: She prelocates the chairs before the guests arrive.
meanings.sent2: The teacher always prelocates the books on the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The cat prelocates its toys in the same spot every day.
meanings.sent4: His habit of prelocating his tools saves him time during projects.
meanings.sent5: Prelocating the ingredients makes cooking dinner much easier.

meanings.definition: To assign a location or position beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The tour guide prelocates the landmarks for the sightseeing tour.
meanings.sent2: Before the event, the organizer prelocates the seating arrangements.
meanings.sent3: The detective prelocates the suspects in the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: The architect prelocates the rooms in the building design.
meanings.sent5: Prelocating the parking spaces helps avoid congestion.
